subject: Communication
title: The Anchoring Effect
description: Learn The Anchoring Effect in one minute.

hook.text: A car dealer shows you a $60,000 car first. Suddenly the $35,000 car feels like a steal.

buildup.text: Anchoring means the first number you hear becomes your mental reference point for everything after.

discovery.text: Kahneman and Tversky found that even random numbers â€” like a roulette wheel â€” bias later estimates.

twist.text: The anchor works even when people know it's arbitrary. Awareness doesn't immunize you from the effect.

climax.text: Retail 'was $100, now $40' uses anchoring. The original price exists only to make the sale price shine.

punchline.text: The first number wins â€” even when it's meaningless.
